meanings.definition: The practice of reclaiming and eating food that has been discarded, typically from dumpsters or grocery store waste.
meanings.sent1: Freeganism is a way to reduce food waste and help the environment.
meanings.sent2: Many people are curious about freeganism and its impact on society.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Sarah joked that she was practicing freeganism by eating the leftover pizza.
meanings.sent4: In a world of abundance, freeganism stands out as a radical but necessary movement.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the challenges and benefits of freeganism in urban areas.

meanings.definition: A person who participates in the lifestyle of minimizing consumption and waste by utilizing discarded items.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor is a dedicated freeganism and always finds treasures in the trash.
meanings.sent2: Freeganism requires creativity and resourcefulness to make the most of discarded goods.
meanings.sent3: During the garage sale, Mark proudly declared himself a freeganism to the amusement of others.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a freeganism, turning unwanted items into useful possessions.
meanings.sent5: The artist's studio was a testament to her commitment to freeganism and sustainable living.
